<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Barbarian Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=671) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
<trait label="Multiclass" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=115" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 221 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Barbarian](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=2)

**Prerequisites**
Strength 14; Constitution 14

</column>

---

You become trained in [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3); if you were already trained in Athletics, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You become trained in barbarian class DC.

 You can use the Rage action.

 Choose an [instinct](/classes/barbarian/instincts) as you would if you were a barbarian. You have that instinct for all purposes and become bound by its anathema, but you don’t gain any of the other abilities it grants.

**Special** You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the barbarian archetype.

<document level="2" id="action-3" />

<title level="2">Barbarian Dedication leads to...</title>
[Barbarian Resiliency](/Feats.aspx?ID=672), [Basic Fury](/Feats.aspx?ID=673), [Instinct Ability](/Feats.aspx?ID=675), [Juggernaut's Fortitude](/Feats.aspx?ID=676)
name: Barbarian Dedication
